name: assert
description: Testing and assertion functionalities for unit testing and validation

assert-true.description: A macro that asserts an expression evaluates to true. Returns nil on success, or a failure object on failure

args.name: name
args.description: Name or description of the test case

args.name: expr
args.description: Expression that should evaluate to true

returns.description: nil if assertion passes, or a map with failure details if it fails

errors: Catches and treats exceptions as assertion failures

assert-false.description: A macro that asserts an expression evaluates to false or nil. Returns nil on success, or a failure object on failure

args.name: name
args.description: Name or description of the test case

args.name: expr
args.description: Expression that should evaluate to false or nil

returns.description: nil if assertion passes, or a map with failure details if it fails

errors: Catches and treats exceptions as assertion failures

assert-throws.description: A macro that asserts an expression throws an exception. Returns nil if an exception is thrown, or a failure object if no exception occurs

args.name: name
args.description: Name or description of the test case

args.name: expr
args.description: Expression that should throw an exception

returns.description: nil if expression throws (assertion passes), or a map with failure details if no exception is thrown

errors: Expected behavior: catches exceptions and treats them as successful assertions

test-suite.description: Runs a test suite with multiple assertion cases. Prints results and returns true if all tests pass, false otherwise

args.name: assert-cases
args.description: Variable number of assertion results (typically from assert-true, assert-false, assert-throws)

returns.description: True if all assertions pass, false if any fail

examples.sideEffect: Prints: TEST SUITE PASS Math Tests PASS
Prints: TEST SUITE FAIL Failing Tests > bad test >> false
